revisions.rev:
{{Update|date=November 2010}}
The '''n Series''' is a [[Dell]] product line that does not ship with a pre-installed version of [[Microsoft Windows]]. Apparently prohibited from shipping computers without an [[operating system]] by an existing licensing agreement with [[Microsoft]], Dell instead ships these systems with either the [[open-source]] [[FreeDOS]] operating system or the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] Linux distribution.
The company has come under fire for making the FreeDOS-powered machines no cheaper and more difficult to purchase than identical systems running Windows<ref>[http://www.theregister.co.uk/2005/10/06/dell_open_pc/ How Dell repels attempts to buy its 'open source' PC | The Register<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>.
Dell also offers various [[Dell Precision|Precision]] Workstations with [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]] pre-installed. These, like all other products in the Precision series, are marketed at enterprises. ==References== <references/>
==External links== *[http://www.dell.com/nseries Dell n Series Website]{{Dead link|date=February 2011}} *[http://www.dell.com/content/topics/global.aspx/alliances/en/linux?c=us&cs=555&l=en&s=biz Dell and Linux] *[http://desktoplinux.com/news/NS3822185143.html Interview with Michael Dell on Desktop Linux] *[http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20070226-8923.html Dell plans to include laptops in the nSeries]
{{Dell Inc}}
